title: ✍️ Executive Order 6102
description: During the Great Depression, on April 5, 1933, U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt signed Executive Order 6102, effectively confiscating gold bullion and coins from individuals and organizations. On this day, we celebrate the (fictional) birthday of Satoshi (April 5, 1975). The date holds symbolic significance—this order remained in effect until 1975. https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a1/Executive_Order_6102.jpg Learn more about the order: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Executive_Order_6102

title: 🧐 Moore's Law is Formulated
description: On April 19, 1965, Gordon Moore, then head of R&D at Fairchild Semiconductor (and later co-founder of Intel in 1968), published an article in the anniversary issue of "Electronics" magazine titled "Cramming More Components onto Integrated Circuits." One of the key ideas in the paper, later known as "Moore’s Law," stated: "The most cost-effective number of transistors on a chip doubles every year." |🗃️ https://web.archive.org/web/20231205080458/http://cs.usu.edu.ru/study/moore/

title: 🥳 Satoshi's Birthday
description: On this day, we celebrate Satoshi's birthday. April 5, 1975, was the birthdate Satoshi provided when registering on the P2P Foundation. The date holds symbolic meaning — April 5th coincides with the date of issuance of Executive Order 6102, which banned private ownership of gold, while 1975 marks the year the order was repealed. |🔗: http://p2pfoundation.ning.com/profile/SatoshiNakamoto

title: 🥳 Ross Ulbricht's Birthday | March 30, 1984
description: Ross Ulbricht was born on March 30, 1984. Ross is the founder of the first open online marketplace that supported #bitcoin, Silk Road. This led to him being sentenced to over two life sentences for nonviolent offenses. | Read more about Ross - his life, Silk Road, imprisonment and pardon: https://www.change.org/p/clemency-for-ross-ulbricht-condemned-to-die-in-prison-for-an-e-commerce-website

title: 💾 Cypherpunks Archives | March 25, 1994
description: Timothy C. May responds to a Cypherpunks mailing list discussion on digital cash, highlighting double-spending as a critical challenge. He proposes online clearing and blinding protocols as potential solutions, though neither fully resolves the issue. |Almost 15 years later, Satoshi Nakamoto shared the Bitcoin whitepaper on the same mailing list, presenting the first complete solution to the double-spending problem. https://i.nostr.build/SE5raM5dLttcJS1k.webp https://mailing-list-archive.cryptoanarchy.wiki/archive/1994/03/b9bcc330ef67da0f0ac96a71799523011f06c61d54ac21b2e381a30a4143e366/

title: 🦘 DigiCash Debuts in Australia | March 26, 1996
description: David Chaum's vision of #digital cash crossed oceans. On this day, DigiCash officially launched in Australia, bringing cryptographic payments to the land down under — years before #Bitcoin would perfect the dream. https://i.nostr.build/AaK8q.png |https://chaum.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/03-26-96-DigiCash-Opens-for-Business-in-Australia-1.pdf

title: 👨‍💻 Hashcash: A Glimpse Into Bitcoin's Future | March 28, 1997
description: Before #Bitcoin, there was #Hashcash. On this day, Adam Back introduced the world to a proof-of-work system designed to fight email spam — never knowing it would later form the backbone of Bitcoin #mining. Thank you, Adam! |🗃️:  https://cypherpunks.venona.com/date/1997/03/msg00774.html

title: 🚜 The Killdozer Day
description: On June 4, 2004, Marvin Heemeyer armored his bulldozer and set out to demolish the properties of local authorities and oligarchs in retaliation for the unjust seizure of his land. He had fought to save his business in court but couldn't defeat bureaucrats on their terms. Police fired over 200 rounds at the bulldozer but failed to stop Marvin. After leveling 13 buildings, he took his own life, becoming the sole casualty of the event—a victim of state tyranny. https://i.nostr.build/gZqZ6.jpg

title: ⛓️ First Mention of the "Blockchain"
description: On April 13, 2009, Satoshi Nakamoto first used the term #blockchain to refer to the total length of the chain. |"I'm trying to think of a better way to phrase this, maybe '%d network blocks' or '%d blockchain'.' https://i.nostr.build/11nqK3dsOPvaMzkB.png https://web.archive.org/web/20240327151616/https://plan99.net/~mike/satoshi-emails/thread1.html

title: 🤑 Bitcoin Marketing Stunt
description: On April 14, 2009, Satoshi Nakamoto pulled a marketing stunt to attract interest in Bitcoin. He promised to return any amount of #bitcoin sent to his address—plus an extra 50 bitcoin. While this was a genuine offer at the time, the tactic later became widely used in scams, where fraudsters target greedy or inexperienced users by promising to double their investments. Of course, no Bitcoin is ever sent back to those who fall for it. https://i.nostr.build/PO2vn.jpg |https://web.archive.org/web/20240327151616/https://plan99.net/~mike/satoshi-emails/thread1.html

title: 🤑 1000 BTC for $3
description: Screenshot of the Bitcoin Market exchange from April 25, 2010. 1000 BTC = $3 https://i.nostr.build/9zejz.jpg

title: 🗺️ The First Bitcoin Journey | March 21, 2011
description: On this day, a bitcoiner hit the road, proving #bitcoin could be more than just digital gold—every mile, meal, and motel paid for with #sats. https://i.nostr.build/RmwYe.jpg |https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4752.0

title: 🗣️ Hal Finney Quote | March 23, 2011
description: Hal Finney cautioned the Bitcointalk community: 'You can't trade your way to success forever.' https://i.nostr.build/hsuUry3s376OZ31J.png | https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4822.msg70817#msg70817

title: 🇬🇧 Britcoin: The UK's First Bitcoin Exchange | March 26, 2011
description: Paving the way for Bitcoin adoption in the UK, Britcoin launched on this day in 2011. It allowed users to trade BTC directly for British pounds — back when Bitcoin was still a niche experiment. https://i.nostr.build/5MbY4MZiQc5JWsG6.png

title: 🇵🇱 Launch of BitMarket.eu
description: On April 5, 2011, BitMarket.eu was launched—the first platform for exchanging #bitcoin for Polish złoty. https://i.nostr.build/8IAnxeFV6EGjgwhj.png https://web.archive.org/web/20110720154216/https://bitmarket.eu/

title: 🎓 One of the First Bitcoin Conferences
description: On April 6, 2011, bitcoiner Genjix spoke at the EPCA #Bitcoin conference in Amsterdam, addressing an audience primarily composed of 50+ year old bankers. https://i.nostr.build/roqwV.jpg https://web.archive.org/web/20110409080100/http://www.dyndy.net/2011/04/bitcoin-presented-to-the-old-world/=20240405T205959Z

title: 📉 First Bitcoin Put Option
description: On April 12, 2011, the first-ever bitcoin put option was sold. The transaction took place via the #bitcoin-otc marketplace. |1 BTC = $0.77 https://i.nostr.build/Uti7IoavaDZ8lyDd.png https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Bitcoin-otc

title: 📁 BitcoinService Changes Hands
description: On April 15, 2011, BitcoinService, a platform allowing users to sell access to uploaded files for Bitcoin, was sold to a new owner. A 200 BTC purchase offer was made just four minutes after the listing went up. The deal was negotiated and finalized within 20 minutes. |1 BTC = $1.00 https://i.nostr.build/O4ejY.png https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5879.0

title: 💩 The Birth of Shitcoins
description: On April 18, 2011, the first #shitcoin, Namecoin, mined its genesis block. Namecoin (NMC) was originally based on Bitcoin and used the Proof-of-Work algorithm, with a supply capped at 21 million coins. |1 BTC = $1.11 https://i.nostr.build/5GQaY.png https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=6017.0 |🗃️ https://web.archive.org/web/20170623005021/https://namecoin.org/

title: 👨‍⚖️ Bitfinex accused of hiding $850M loss
description: On April 25, 2019, Bitfinex was accused of covering up an $850 million loss using Tether (USDT). |1 BTC = $5,454 https://i.nostr.build/lLlxM.png https://web.archive.org/web/20201107230000/https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitfinex-allegedly-covers-850-million-loss-with-tether-funds |On February 23, 2021, Bitfinex and Tether admitted fault and paid an $18.5 million fine: https://web.archive.org/web/20230929015558/https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/02/23/ny-ags-850m-probe-of-bitfinex-tether-ends-in-an-185m-settlement/

title: 🗞️ The First Bitcoin Magazine | March-27-2012
description: Bitcoin's first print magazine, "Coineer - The Bitcoin Magazine", launched in Canadian bookstores, later expanding to the U.S. The quarterly publication covered #Bitcoin adoption, businesses, and industry developments.  https://i.nostr.build/lH6H18mAA66CPU8b.png | https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=74346.0

title: 👨‍💻 Bitcoin v0.6 Arrives | March 30, 2011
description: Faster sync, QR codes, and wallet backups—Bitcoin v0.6 made running a node easier than ever. |The update cut sync time, added message signing, and shrank transactions with compressed keys.  |🗃️: https://bitcoin.org/en/release/v0.6.0

title: 🇧🇷 Bitcoin Arrives in Brazil | March 31, 2011
description: On this day, Bitcoin Brazil launched, becoming the first platform to exchange BTC for Brazilian real. Another step toward global adoption. https://i.nostr.build/jPB4RKGvGq34u0rD.png |https://web.archive.org/web/20120118193930/http://www.mercadobitcoin.com.br/

title: 🚙 First Bitcoin-Funded Road Trip
description: On April 9, 2011, a Bitcoiner known as PLATO embarked on a cross-country journey across the U.S., making history as the first person to travel coast to coast using Bitcoin. An estimated 500 BTC was raised for the trip. BTC price at departure (April 9): $0.75 BTC price at arrival (June 13): $18.55 https://i.nostr.build/YgE87.jpg |Trip announcement: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4752.msg81244#msg81244 |Travel blog: https://web.archive.org/web/20110829090643/http://therealplato.com/page/3

title: 🗣️ Bitcoin is in good hands
description: On April 23, 2011, in an email exchange with Mike Hearn, Satoshi mentioned that he had "moved on to other things." |1 BTC = $1.41 https://i.nostr.build/mlv3G.png 🗃️: https://web.archive.org/web/20230713073944/ https://plan99.net/~mike/satoshi-emails/thread5.html

title: 🚀 Bitcoin market cap hits $10M
description: On April 23, 2011, the total value of all #bitcoin in circulation hit the $10 million mark. |1 BTC = $1.41 https://i.nostr.build/LeVdW.gif

title: 🚰 Liberty Reserve user data leak
description: On April 26, 2011, a vulnerability was discovered in the Liberty Reserve exchange platform. User data was being leaked to its hosting provider, Amazon. https://i.nostr.build/3PYgM.png https://web.archive.org/web/20171126111442/http://permalink.gmane.org/gmane.comp.finance.gold-silver-crypto/22812

title: 🚔 Gavin Andresen to brief the CIA
description: On April 27, 2011, Gavin Andresen posted on bitcointalk announcing that he would be speaking at CIA headquarters that summer about #Bitcoin. https://i.nostr.build/kZ8Vj.png https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=6652.0=20240426T205959Z

title: 🌪️ Bitcoin Donations for Hurricane Victims
description: On April 29, 2011, the first-ever #bitcoin fundraising campaign for disaster relief was launched. PLATO, a bitcoiner traveling from the U.S. East Coast to the West, was near Montgomery, Alabama, when a devastating storm struck. He started a bitcoin fundraiser, ultimately collecting 41.75 BTC. A month later, Bitcoin’s price had surged nearly 15x. |1 BTC = $2.21 https://i.nostr.build/dwM0Y.png https://bitcointalk.org/?topic=6752.msg101417#msg101417

title: ⛏️ Mining Difficulty Surpasses 100,000
description: On April 30, 2011, #Bitcoin mining difficulty crossed 100,000 for the first time. |1 BTC = $2.88 |More about difficulty adjustment: https://21ideas.org/en/difficulty/

title: 🏢 Bitcoin Meets Real Estate | March 24, 2012
description: In a landmark moment for adoption, a Las Vegas asset management company — holding over 100 commercial and residential properties — took the plunge and began accepting #bitcoin for rent and real estate purchases. The future of property transactions had just taken a step toward #decentralization. https://i.nostr.build/XV5uQ0E1u43MxIq2.png |https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=73712.msg816851#msg816851

title: 👨‍💻 P2SH Goes Live | April 1, 2012
description: Bitcoin got smarter at block 173805 — P2SH went live. Instead of locking coins to a single key, it let users send funds to a script hash. The spending rules? Hidden until needed, enabling #multisig wallets and more flexible transactions. | Find out more about P2SH and other Bitcoin address types: https://21ideas.org/en/bitcoin-address-types/#p2sh |Bitcoin Wiki: https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Pay_to_script_hash

title: ✅ First MSB License for a Bitcoin Exchange
description: On March 29, 2012, BitInstant became the first Bitcoin exchange to receive a Money Services Business (MSB) license in the U.S. The exchange was founded by Charlie Shrem. https://i.nostr.build/xfCDIb1cL4y7Vs4Y.jpg |https://web.archive.org/web/20120430193549/http://payglo.be/2012/04/19/bitinstant-federally-licensed-bitcoin-exchange/

title: 🐪 The 50,000 Bitcoin Scam
description: On April 20, 2012, a Silk Road vendor scammed users out of 50,000 BTC. A highly rated seller on the Silk Road marketplace convinced numerous buyers to prepay for orders, lured by discounts tied to the annual 4/20 promotions. After collecting 50,000 BTC in payments, the vendor, known as Tony76, vanished—keeping both the money and the drugs. |1 BTC = $5.14 https://i.nostr.build/8GqKv.jpg https://web.archive.org/web/20240405103927/https://threadreaderapp.com/thread/1649034522330054656.html

title: 🎶 First music album sold for Bitcoin
description: On April 25, 2012, the first music album was put up for sale exclusively for #bitcoin before being released on iTunes and other music stores. https://i.nostr.build/f50TmM7cqt37HPTg.png |https://web.archive.org/web/20130603204917/https://www.coindl.com/page/item/127

title: 🎥 First WebCam Site with BTC Payments
description: On April 29, 2012, the first live webcam site with #bitcoin payments launched. Payments were sent directly to performers. The site cam4btc(dot)com operated on a tipping model. |1 BTC = $134.44 https://i.nostr.build/lgUYku2bFXlD9Kja.png https://web.archive.org/web/20120506003540/ http://ptvheaven.com/accounts/register/

title: 📚 'Bitcoin and Me' | March 19, 2013
description: Hal Finney's post "Bitcoin and Me" reflects on his role in Bitcoin's early days, from #mining his first blocks to his correspondence with Satoshi Nakamoto. |Despite his battle with ALS, he continued contributing to Bitcoin's development. His story highlights both his technical legacy and personal perseverance in the face of illness. |🔗: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=155054.msg1643833#msg1643833

title: 🤑 Bitcoin Hits a Billion | March 28, 2013
description: For the first time, Bitcoin's market capitalization soared past $1 billion. The world was starting to pay attention—this wasn't just "magic internet money" anymore. https://i.nostr.build/6GdmO.jpg

title: 🚀 Bitcoin Breaks $100 | April 1, 2013
description: From cents to dollars, now triple digits—Bitcoin crossed the $100 mark on Mt. Gox and major exchanges, proving it was more than just "magic internet money". https://i.nostr.build/6GdmO.jpg

title: 🪦 Bitcoin Obituary | April 3, 2013
description: The Guardian publishes an article "Bitcoin is the Harlem Shake of currency". As you might have noticed, it didn't not age well: |"Despite the hype, #Bitcoin is used by very few people. It is not a legitimate currency just because it had a bubble" |1 BTC = $115 https://i.nostr.build/ph3R2LR4S9cfacZJ.png https://web.archive.org/web/20131030110314/http://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2013/apr/03/bitcoin-currency-bubble-crash-not-rocking-financial-markets

title: 🚀 Bitcoin Breaks $200
description: On April 9, 2013, Bitcoin’s price surpassed $200 for the first time. https://i.nostr.build/6GdmO.jpg 🗃️: https://web.archive.org/web/20230530142723/ https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2013/04/09/176708504/bitcoin-surpasses-200-mark-continuing-epic-rise

title: 👮‍♂️ First Bitcoin Seizure by the U.S. DEA
description: On June 21, 2013, the U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration seized 11.02 BTC from a South Carolina man attempting to purchase illicit substances with what they called "magic internet money". This was the first known case of Bitcoin confiscation by the U.S. government, marking the moment federal authorities started taking Bitcoin seriously. https://i.nostr.build/LeBMM.jpg https://web.archive.org/web/20130729231823/http://letstalkbitcoin.com/post/53700133097/users-bitcoins-seized-by-dea

title: 🪦 Bitcoin Obituary
description: On April 13, 2013, Bloomberg published an article titled "Virtual Bitcoin Mining Is a Real-World Environmental Disaster." |1 BTC = $117 |https://i.nostr.build/oMEEL.png https://web.archive.org/web/20220401001837/https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2013-04-12/virtual-bitcoin-mining-is-a-real-world-environmental-disaster

title: 🗣️ Adam Back's Quote
description: On April 18, 2013, Adam Back commented on Satoshi’s coins. |1 BTC = $93.07 https://i.nostr.build/8Gvva.png |https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=178629.msg1879728#msg1879728

title: 🥷 Bitcoin Central Hacked
description: On April 20, 2013, the European exchange Bitcoin Central was hacked, resulting in the loss of "several hundred bitcoins." The platform’s owners covered the losses out of pocket. |1 BTC = $118.48 https://web.archive.org/web/20211124022124/https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2013/04/29/hackers-hit-bitcoin-central-exchange/

title: 🗣️ Adam Back's Quote
description: On April 21, 2013, Adam Back shared his thoughts on Satoshi’s genius. https://i.nostr.build/lLKKw.png https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=182252.msg1906692#msg1906692

title: 💰 TelcoGreen Accepts Bitcoin
description: On April 28, 2013, TelcoGreen became the first Australian telecommunications provider to accept #bitcoin as payment. |1 BTC = $128 https://i.nostr.build/BRX6Y.png

title: 🔧 Bitcoin v0.9 Arrives | March 19, 2014
description: Bitcoin Core rebranded and introduced new features, including OP_RETURN for prunable outputs, and a new 64-bit Windows client. |The update also split the bitcoin-cli into its own executable and enhanced transaction malleability fixes. |🗃️: https://bitcoin.org/en/release/v0.9.0

title: 🎙️ Antonopoulos on Joe Rogan
description: On April 23, 2014, Andreas Antonopoulos explained the significance of #Bitcoin on the world's most popular podcast show. |1 BTC = $484 |🎥: https://youtu.be/l5ntCCU2520?si=nVxJaJbXnInI64jr |🌐: https://www.jrepodcast.com/episode/joe-rogan-experience-490-andreas-antonopoulos/

title: 👮‍♂️ Corruption in the Silk Road Case | March 30, 2015
description: The Bitcoin underworld wasn't just Silk Road—on this day, two DEA agents investigating the case were arrested for stealing Bitcoin. One moved $800,000 in BTC to his personal Mt. Gox account; the other extorted funds while secretly working for a crypto exchange. |Force has pocketed hundreds of thousands of dollars in bitcoin with Silk Road. He was also accused of secretly working for the CoinMKT exchange, using his DEA authority to remove clients' funds from the exchange and then using a subpoena to payment firm Venmo to try to unfreeze his frozen assets.   https://i.nostr.build/TvyRW5SptsuRd72A.png |https://archive.ph/OmCBV

title: 🪦 Bitcoin Obituary
description: On April 7, 2015, the director of Bitreserve predicted in an interview that Bitcoin would be gone within five years. 1 BTC = $223 https://i.nostr.build/WGDBk.png https://web.archive.org/web/20231003005130/https://www.coinfox.info/news/persons/1791-bitreserve-s-new-coo-bitcoin-will-go-away-in-5-years/

title: 🪦 Bitcoin Obituary
description: On April 19, 2016, Daniel Roberts published an interview on Yahoo Finance with the CEO of the international payments company TransferWise. The executive declared, "Bitcoin is dead." |"I think it's safe to say Bitcoin is dead. There’s no traction, nobody is using Bitcoin. The Bitcoin experiment, I think we can call it over.' |1 BTC = $429.05 https://i.nostr.build/J6vMr.png https://web.archive.org/web/20221204131344/https://finance.yahoo.com/news/bitcoin-is-dead-says-prominent-fintech-executive-taavet-hinrikus-transferwise-bitcoin-experiment-failed-191800988.html

title: 👨‍💻 Base32 Address Format Proposed | March 20, 2017
description: On March 20, 2017, Greg Maxwell and Peter Wuille proposed Base32 as a replacement for the outdated Base58 Bitcoin address format. Base32 addresses are more efficient and are used in SegWit transactions. https://i.nostr.build/KEvUSBqMlrPWOrHj.png  |https://nt4tn.net/papers/bip173.pdf |📧 https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2017-March/013749.html

title: 📑 Bitcoin-dev Archives | March 24, 2017
description: In this email thread, developers explored #mining centralization risks, debating empty block attacks and the declining role of independent full nodes. Various ideas were considered to strengthen Bitcoin's security, but no definitive solution emerged. While the issue remains open, discussions like these drive Bitcoin's continuous evolution. https://i.nostr.build/GFGndnnvMvRPcyOO.png https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/5b9ba6c4-6d8f-9c0b-2420-2be6c30f87b5@cannon-ciota.info/

title: 🕰️ 'Moscow Time' Meme is Born | March 25, 2021
description: During a congressional hearing, Jack Dorsey's Blockclock Mini, displaying the sats/USD rate, sparked confusion in the normieland. Cybersecurity analyst Chris Vickery mistakenly claimed it showed Moscow time, fueling conspiracy theories. Bitcoiners embraced the term 'Moscow Time' as shorthand for the sat/USD conversion rate: the lower it is, the stronger Bitcoin's purchasing power. When 00:00 strikes, it's hyperbitcoinization time, baby. | https://gizmodo.com/heres-the-weird-clock-on-jack-dorseys-kitchen-counter-1846553535

title: 📚 Notable Publication
description: On April 12, 2021, professor Peter St. Onge published his article "Critics Claim Bitcoin Is a Threat to the Environment. They're Wrong". |🔗: https://21ideas.org/en/bitcoin-is-not-harmful-for-the-environment/

title: 🏪 Coinbase Goes Public
description: On April 14, 2021, Coinbase was officially listed on NASDAQ, becoming a publicly traded company. |Get your #bitcoin off Coinbase! |1 BTC = $63,564 |https://i.nostr.build/6GKlP.png |https://web.archive.org/web/20211108205709/https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2021/04/14/coinbase-direct-listing-gets-100b-valuation-as-share-price-jumps-in-nasdaq-debut/

title: 🥇 Bitcoin Enters Guinness as Most Valuable Cryptocurrency | March 24, 2022
description: On this day Guinness World Records officially recognized Bitcoin as the most valuable cryptocurrency. https://i.nostr.build/2R6rA.png | https://web.archive.org/web/20231204133924/https://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/696457-most-valuable-cryptocurrency

title: 📚 'Bitcoin and Ocean Thermal Energy' | April 4, 2022

title: 🔦 A Message to the ECB: Study Bitcoin | March 31, 2023
description: Bitcoiners took their message straight to the European Central Bank — projecting 'Study Bitcoin' alongside the ₿ symbol onto its headquarters. https://i.nostr.build/4oeQm.jpg

title: 🌓 Second BCH Halving | April 4, 2024
description: Bitcoin Cash undergoes its second halving at block #840,000, cutting miner rewards in half. As expected, miners flee, hash rate collapses, and block times drag. Another step on the inevitable path to irrelevance. https://i.nostr.build/mlvqQ.png

title: 👨‍💻 Bitcoin Core v26.0 Released
description: On April 7, 2024, Bitcoin Core v26.0 was officially released. |🔗: https://bitcoincore.org/en/releases/26.0/

title: 👮‍♂️ Samourai Wallet founders arrested
description: On April 24, 2024, the founders of Samourai Wallet were arrested on charges of money laundering. U.S. Department of Justice prosecutors allege that Samourai Wallet laundered over $100 million in criminal proceeds. https://i.nostr.build/KGor3.png https://www.justice.gov/usao-sdny/pr/founders-and-ceo-cryptocurrency-mixing-service-arrested-and-charged-money-laundering

title: 📝 "Buy Bitcoin" sign sold for $1,000,000
description: On April 25, 2024, the iconic "Buy Bitcoin" sign, which sparked a wave of interest not just in its creator but in #Bitcoin itself, sold at auction on ScarceCity for an incredible 16 BTC. The historic artifact was officially handed over at PubKey bar in Manhattan. |What started as a simple notepad sketch in 2017 to troll Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen became a viral #meme, catapulting Christian Langalis—now simply known as "the Buy Bitcoin Guy"—to unexpected fame. https://i.nostr.build/VwDoJ.png https://scarce.city/auctions/buy-bitcoin
